required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Modified Playground Environment on Health, Particularly Immune System
clinical_study.official_title: ImmunoGarden - Effect of Modified Playground Environment on Health, Particularly Immune System

brief_summary.textblock: Children were exposed to biodiverse material or non-diverse material in sand pits. The two arms were compared. Immune response and bacterial markers were followed.

detailed_description.textblock: Children of age 3-5 were randomly divided into two groups (arms). One received guidance and biodiverse material for 20 minutes each day for two weeks. The other received the a similar material and guidance but the microbial community in the material was poor in diversity. Bacterial community changes and immune system markers were analyzed and compared between the two arms. Potential changes in Interleukin 10 was the primary outcome.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: One arm received biodiversity sand and the other arm normal sand.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants nor their parents did not know the arm. Care providers did not know the group as they did not know the content of the sand box. Investigators and field assistants knew the content in each sand box but they did not know the coding of the arms when they analyzed the differences in cytokine levels. Outcomes assessors i.e. nurses who took blood samples did not know the arms nor the contents of the sand boxes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Interleukin 10 level in blood
primary_outcome.description: The difference between day 0 and a follow up day in intervention

secondary_outcome.description: all potential changes in bacterial profile are measured on skin and stool samples
all measured changes in interleukin 17 levels
potential changes in the ratio of these two citokines
potential changes that last for four weeks

arm_group.description: The children were in daily contact with biodiversity sand 5 days a week for two weeks.
Children were in contact with normal but colored sand that looked as it were the biodiversity sand. All the other details were as above.

intervention.description: Biodiversity sand contained biodiversity powder that contains a highly diverse and rich microbial community but no known pathogens.
Sand that looks like intervention sand but does not have high biodiversity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy
- born in Finland
- spends daily (5 d a week) several hours in one of the daycares in which the trial was performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- medication affecting immune system function
- medication affecting microbiota
- cancer
- immune deficiency
- living on a farm
- not born in Finland

patient_data.ipd_description: The local ethical committee and the law in Finland retricts the sharing of information that could lead to distinguishing a study participant. Microbial information is considered to faciliation the identification of study participants. Microbial information will be partly shared to public databases (sequences).
